news.title: Jharkhand HC refuses to vacate stay on allocation of sand ghats in state
news.para: The Jharkhand High Court has refused to lift the stay on sand ghat allocations, directing Adivasi Buddhijivi Manch to respond to the state government's plea. This decision follows a contempt petition filed by the Manch, alleging non-compliance with the Panchayat Extension of Scheduled Areas (PESA) Act.

news.title: Punjab cabinet nod to collect charges for lands village land encroachments
news.para: The Punjab cabinet has approved measures to claim charges for illegally occupied village common lands, empowering authorities to collect payments from encroachers, shared between local bodies and the state. Amendments to the Right to Business Act will expedite approvals for industries, while a special NIA court in Mohali aims to accelerate trial proceedings.

news.title: Bombay HC appoints architects to look at structural damage complaints in SRA project in Dharavi
news.para: Bombay High Court intervened in a dispute over construction near Dharavi. Residents of Kamraj Nagar building claimed a new project damaged their structure. The court appointed architects to inspect the site. They will assess structural integrity and suggest remedies. The inspection is set for October 1. A report is expected by October 7.

news.title: Greater Bengaluru authority to launch mobile app for e-khata applications
news.para: Bengaluru's Greater Bengaluru Authority is launching a mobile app for e-khata applications, streamlining the process for property owners. The app, expected to be operational soon, allows direct submission of applications with required documents. This initiative aims to enhance accessibility and user-friendliness, building on the existing web application that processes thousands of applications daily.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh government restores plot in Noida to GPL Infrabuild, extends zero-period waiver
news.para: The UP government overturned Noida Authority's decision to cancel GPL Infrabuild's plot allotment in Sector 106, citing delayed possession due to an unresolved high-tension power line issue. The state government emphasized that allotments cannot be cancelled if encumbrance-free possession wasn't provided.

news.title: Gentex Merchants buys Lutyens’ bungalow for ₹310 crore
news.para: Gentex Merchants Pvt Ltd, linked to Lakshmi Mittal, acquired a 3,540 square yard bungalow on APJ Abdul Kalam Road in Delhi's Lutyens’ Bungalow Zone for Rs 310 crore. The property was previously owned by Yashwant Singh, who recently purchased a bungalow in Golf Links. This transaction highlights the continued demand for high-value properties in India's most prestigious neighborhood.

news.title: House tax in Margao up by 300% as council adopts new method
news.para: Margao Municipal Council's new capital value method for calculating house tax has triggered a massive surge in property taxes, exceeding 300% for new residential and commercial properties. This shift from rental value to asset-based taxation, driven by a directorate circular, significantly impacts new property owners.

news.title: Goa housing board to take PPP or JV route to complete residential projects
news.para: The Goa Housing Board (GHB) plans to finalize incomplete residential projects through joint ventures or public-private partnerships, starting with a 50% completed complex in Porvorim. A consultant will be appointed to assist in selecting developers and assessing the remaining work.

news.title: BKC co-operative housing society tenants move Bombay HC for their ‘rightful’ homes
news.para: Residents of Basera SRA Co-operative Housing Society are fighting for larger 550 sq ft units, claiming their area isn't a slum and demanding MHADA norms be followed. The Apex Grievance Redressal Committee has stayed demolition notices, requesting clarification from developers. Frustrated by delays and alleged builder misconduct, residents plan protests, seeking cancellation of the SRA scheme and action against officials.

news.title: Allahabad HC bench seeks records of single judge order staying demolition of building
news.para: The Allahabad High Court's Lucknow bench has expressed concern over a single bench order that stayed the demolition of an illegal building in Khurram Nagar. The division bench has summoned records to investigate the urgency behind the stay, especially considering a prior demolition order.

news.title: Real estate stocks decline amid sluggish demand concerns
news.para: Real estate stocks are experiencing a downturn, extending losses for the third consecutive session due to concerns about slowing demand and profit-taking after a significant rally. The realty index has underperformed the Nifty, with several key stocks like Godrej Properties and DLF seeing notable declines. Analysts anticipate potential further drops amid sluggish demand and strong supply.

news.title: IBM leases 61,000 sq ft workspace at Incuspaze's Green Boulevard in Noida
news.para: IBM has expanded its footprint in India by leasing 61,000 sq. ft. of managed workspace with Incuspaze in Noida, adding to its existing 260,000 sq ft in Gurgaon. This move reflects the growing demand for flexible workspace solutions among multinational corporations, driven by factors like GCC expansion and the rise of unicorn startups.

news.title: Palakkad Smart City: Kerala completes tender procedures
news.para: Kerala has finalized the tender for infrastructure development at the Palakkad Smart City, a key node in the Kochi-Bengaluru Industrial Corridor. A joint venture between Dilip Buildcon and PSP Projects secured the Rs 1,316.13 crore contract.

news.title: Home prices in Germany rise as depressed property sector seeks momentum
news.para: German home prices experienced a 3.2% increase in the second quarter, marking the third consecutive rise as the sector stabilizes after a recession. Despite these gains, values remain below their 2022 peak due to inflation and high interest rates. While residential property shows resilience, other real estate segments like offices and retail face challenges amid economic weakness and rising insolvencies.

news.title: Delhi CM urges LG for expediting master plan 2041
news.para: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta has urged Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena to expedite the 'Master Plan 2041' to address the city's growing needs, emphasizing its importance for future generations. Gupta highlighted the need for a concrete plan that serves the people's interests, while Saxena affirmed the focus on implementing the master plan promptly.

news.title: SC asks builder to refund over ₹43 lakh with 18% interest
news.para: The Supreme Court has ordered a real estate company to refund Rajnish Sharma. Sharma will receive over Rs 43 lakh with 18 percent interest. This reverses an earlier order by the NCDRC. The NCDRC had set the interest at 9 percent. Sharma had booked a plot in 2006. He alleged undue delay and unfair charges.

news.title: Architecture admissions remain dismal in Karnataka, with under 50% of seats filled
news.para: Architecture's popularity is waning among students in Karnataka, with less than half of available seats filled this year. Several colleges face zero intake, prompting concerns about the National Aptitude Test in Architecture (NATA) and its impact on accessibility. Experts suggest the test creates disparities and question its necessity given the low demand.

news.title: Unauthorised constructions under lens after building collapse in Indore
news.para: A building collapse in Indore's Ranipura area, resulting in two fatalities and multiple injuries, has exposed critical lapses in building regulations and safety standards. The three-story structure, initially permitted for ground-plus-one, had unauthorized additions and a neglected, waterlogged basement. This continuous seepage severely weakened the foundation, leading to the tragic collapse in the densely populated area.

news.title: Coimbatore corporation’s model to reuse rainwater gains traction
news.para: Coimbatore Corporation is successfully reusing rainwater. The corporation implemented a unique system at its main office. This system collects and filters rainwater for non-potable uses. Encouraged by the results, the corporation plans to expand the system. It will be implemented in its five zonal offices. This promotes sustainable water management. The system reduces dependency on borewell water.

news.title: Hubballi-Dharwad development body expands its LPA area in twin cities
news.para: The Hubballi-Dharwad Urban Development Authority has expanded its Local Planning Area to 757 square kilometers, incorporating 46 new villages. This expansion aims to curb illegal layouts, promote systematic development, and provide improved infrastructure to the newly included villages. A new master plan for 2041 is being prepared to guide future development in the region.
